full_summary:
### Advance Procurement Notice for DRDC Facilities Maintenance and Support Services

#### Introduction
This advance procurement notice serves as a preliminary notice of potential contract opportunity for procurement of Facilities Maintenance and Support Services to DRDC Toronto, Ontario.

#### Project Description
The services to be provided encompass inspection, testing, maintenance, and repair of various systems within the DRDC Toronto facility. The services include, but are not limited to: HVACR, electrical, plumbing, fire detection and suppression, elevators and lifting systems, security and access control, doors, generators, structural and architectural elements, and support services such as snow and ice management, landscaping, environmental management, waste management, integrated pest management, cleaning and janitorial services.

#### Contract Details
The initial contract period is expected to be 5 years with an estimated value of $8.5 million. Extension options are available for up to two (2) periods, totaling ten (10) years, with a maximum value of $17.7 million. Pursuant to Department of National Defence approval, it is anticipated that the Request for Proposal (RFP) will be initiated in March 2024.

#### Security Clearance Requirements
To be eligible for contract award, contractors must hold a valid and active FACILITY SECURITY CLEARANCE (FSC) at the level of SECRET from the Contract Security Program (CSP). Defence Construction Canada (DCC) will sponsor contractors to access the security clearance application process under its Industrial Security Program (ISP). Interested contractors should submit a sponsorship request application to DCC online.

#### Download Request for Proposal (RFP) Documents
The RFP documents are available for downloading at http://www.merx.com. Fees may apply - please refer to the Merx website for details. Please direct any inquiries to Neharika Verma at (416) 434-5095 or TTContracting@dcc-cdc.gc.ca. (613) 998-8974 and ISP.Sponsorship@dcc-cdc.gc.ca for any questions pertaining to sponsorship process and ISP. * 

### Disclaimer
In participating in either the sponsorship process or the security clearance application process, the contractor acknowledges any risks associated with the completeness or accuracy of their application, as well as the timeliness of processing and granting security clearance. By proceeding, the contractor assumes responsibility for all such risks.
